title: Rolling - disk attached to string is dropped

content.description: One end of a string of negligible mass is wrapped around a disk and the other end is attached to a ceiling, as shown. The disk is released from rest at position <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and the string does not slip on the disk. When the disk reaches position <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, the absolute value of the change in the gravitational potential energy of the disk‑Earth system is <math alttext="delta U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>U</mi></math>. Which of the following correctly compares the total kinetic energy and the rotational kinetic energy of the disk to <math alttext="delta U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>U</mi></math> ?
